author: Tom Powell
title: Boy in Year 7 dies after falling down stairwell at school in Norwich | London Evening Standard
text:
Thursday 2 February 2017 11:41 BST Click to follow Tragedy: the boy fell at Jane Austen College in Norwich Google StreetView 
A young boy has died in hospital after falling down a stairwell at his school. 
The year seven pupil, named only as Michael in reports, fell at Jane Austen College in Norwich on January 23. 
He was flown to hospital by air ambulance with serious head injuries but his school announced today that he had died. 
In the statement, he was described as a "well-known" pupil with a "lively personality". 
The school said: "A student was admitted to hospital on Monday, January 23, following an accident at the school. 
“Despite the best efforts of medical staff, he did not recover from his injuries and died in hospital. 
“Our thoughts are with his family and friends. We are making sure that fellow students have the support they need both immediately and in the days ahead.” 
A Justgiving page set up to raise money for the boy while he was fighting for his life in hospital has almost reached £2,000. 
A parents’ evening planned for Thursday has been postponed but pupils at the school were still advised to attend during the day as normal. 
Principal Rebecca Handley Kirk said: "We are devastated by these events, and we send our thoughts and our love to Michael's family and friends. 
"Michael had only joined us in September, but was already becoming a well-known student throughout the school, thanks to his lively personality. Michael enjoyed football, making jokes and being with his friends. Read more
